author: MPX
title: MTP Daily 5/22/20
description: MTP Daily is a public affairs program hosted by Chuck Todd that follows the Trump administration and features the top news-makers of the day as they analyze and break down the issues.
content:
MTP Daily 05/22/20 
 MTP Daily is a public affairs program hosted by Chuck Todd that follows the Trump administration and features the top news-makers of the day as they analyze and break down the i… [+113 chars]
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Brazil president ‘looking the other way’ as nation becomes world’s No. 2 coronavirus hotspot
description: NBC News’ Bill Neely: “There is a crisis here, but as far as President Bolsonaro is concerned, he’s looking the other way.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Invoking Obama, Biden faces 'debt' to black voters in clash with radio host Charlamagne
description: During an in-depth interview with “Breakfast Club” Radio host Charlemagne Tha God on Thursday, Joe Biden defended his record on crime, civil rights and his relationship with the black community. When signing off, Biden made a controversial comment suggesting …
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Chris Hayes: Trump has failed us, but we shouldn't fail each...
description: Chris Hayes: “This pandemic is a challenge and test for our federal government, which has thus far failed us. But it is also a challenge for us, for our society about what we value and who we value, and how we express that we are looking out for each other.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Public health expert: Keep wearing a face mask
description: UCLA's Dr. Anne Rimoin joins to discuss the importance wearing face masks will continue to have in fighting the coronavirus pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: 'Flooding the zone with excrement': Schiff explains Trump's...
description: Rep. Adam Schiff, chairman of the House Intelligence Committee, explains that the Trump administration's real goal in spinning a befuddling narrative around Mike Flynn is in keeping with a political strategy of distraction as articulated by Steve Bannon.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Pandemic expert on the dangers of rushing a COVID-19 vaccine
description: Dr. Irwin Redlener joins to discuss the quick timeline coming from Trump officials on when a coronavirus vaccine may be available.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump wants churches reopened as U.S. deaths near 100,000
description: Despite several COVID-19 outbreaks across the globe being tied to religious gatherings, Trump is pushing for states to reopen houses of worship calling them 'essential' as the U.S. death toll tops 96,000 people.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Jon Meacham: Trump makes Richard Nixon look like Mr. Rogers
description: Reacting to the president's behavior during the coronavirus pandemic, presidential historians Jon Meacham and Michael Beschloss react to what they see as self-centered reactions from Trump.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Rachel Maddow 5/22/20
description: Watch the full episode of Friday night's The Rachel Maddow Show.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Workplace coronavirus outbreaks not limited to meat plants
description: Rachel Maddow looks at how the coronavirus is turning up in a variety of workplaces where workers are in close proximity to each other, not just at meat...
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: Contact tracings show risk of coronavirus spread through churches
description: Rachel Maddow looks at how contact tracings have taught us that church gatherings have been a particular point of vulnerability for the spread of coronavirus in the United States, a fact not changed by Donald Trump's posturing.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Midwest states loosen COVID-19 restrictions ahead of Memorial Day
description: Ahead of the first big holiday weekend of the summer season, plenty of states are reopening to some degree despite the continued increase in COVID-19 cases in the U.S. NBC News Correspondent Cal Perry reports from Plymouth, Indiana.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: OSHA oddly reticent despite worker peril in coronavirus era
description: Jessica Martinez, co-executive director of the National Council for Occupational Safety and Health, talks with Rachel Maddow about OSHA reducing enforcement of worker safety despite the obviously increased danger the coronavirus poses to workers.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Absent federal help, Americans muster public health strategies
description: Rachel Maddow remarks on local and individual efforts to help educate and protect Americans from the coronavirus while the federal government is either no help or, in the case of Donald Trump, a public danger.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MPX
title: All In 5/22/20
description: Chris Hayes discusses the day's top political news.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump’s demand that houses of worship reopen met with dire warnings
description: President Donald Trump declared places of worship essential on Friday, claiming he would override any state governors who do not allow public indoor services to proceed. There has never been a ban on religious services per se, but many sites have offered remo…
source.name: MSNBC

title: Michigan Secy. of State: Trump's tweets were attempt to cause doubt in election process
description: Michigan Secretary of State Joceylyn Benson spoke to Alex Witt about President Trump's criticism of her decision to send mail-in ballot applications to voters in the state. She claimed his tweets were an attempt to "sow seeds of doubt" in the election
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: North Dakota Gov. Burgum makes emotional plea on wearing face masks
description: As protests against coronavirus restrictions continue, North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum made an emotional plea for people not to "mask shame" others who chose to wear them.  Eddie Glaude discusses the impact President Trump has had on these protests and the …
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: New Jersey beaches reopen for Memorial Day weekend
description: New Jersey beaches have reopened to visitors for Memorial Day weekend with social distancing guidelines encouraged. NBC's Maura Barrett has details.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump campaign chief accused of ‘cashing checks’ not doing job
description: Donald Trump’s campaign head is accused of making millions off running the campaign, in addition to other figures in the president’s orbit who appear to be profiting off his presidency and re-election efforts. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Some GOP governors accused of manipulating COVID-19 statistics
description: Coronavirus statistics are being manipulated by GOP governors’ administrations in states such as Georgia and Florida critics say. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Pompeo’s elite dinners were ‘corrupt’ former U.S. ambassador says
description: Sec. of State Michael Pompeo’s lavish Madison Dinners did not have a single Democrat, according to reports. Joy Reid and her panel discuss these supposedly diplomatic events that targeted wealthy, conservative Americans using taxpayer dollars, and other actio…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sec. Pompeo revelations add to ‘what we've already known about how he’s abusing his position'
description: Former State Department official Mike Fuchs points to previous concerns that Secretary of State Mike Pompeo was violating the Hatch Act with trips to Kansas for a potential Senate run.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Velshi: ‘America First’ approach ignores our critical role on the world stage
description: MSNBC’s Ali Velshi argues that Trump’s withdrawal from the Open Skies treaty is another dangerously isolationist move for the United States.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rep. Kelly: The CDC report on race and coronavirus was ‘pitiful’
description: Congresswomen Karen Bass of California and Robin Kelly of Illinois say the Centers for Disease Control “should have been ashamed” to release the 2.5-page report on coronavirus victim demographics without any new data.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: ‘The president is wrong on every level' about voting by mail
description: MI lieutenant gov. Garlin Gilchrist responds to Trump’s threat to cut off state funding over the mailing of absentee ballots.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rev. Sharpton on Biden’s ‘You ain’t black’ comment: ‘Our votes have to be attached to an agenda’
description: Rev. Al Sharpton, host of MSNBC’s “Politics Nation,” urges Joe Biden to “deliver a platform and a policy that we believe you can enact.”
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Michigan attorney general: 'There's not a Constitutional right to get your hair cut'
description: MI attorney general Dana Nessel discusses protests against the stay-at-home order after calling Trump a “petulant child” for refusing to wear a mask during his tour of a local Ford factory.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: McConnell resumes focus on federal judges amid pandemic
description: The coronavirus pandemic will not delay Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell in his quest to confirm as many federal judges as possible, according to his own statements. Meanwhile, the recently-passed House HEROES Act which would help the nation cope with t…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Documentary reveals 'Jane Roe' of Roe V. Wade was paid to reverse abortion stance
description: Norma McCorvey, known for years as Jane Roe the plaintiff from one of the most famous Supreme Court cases in history: Roe v. Wade, reveals that she was paid to reverse her stance from pro-choice to anti-abortion by Operation Rescue, now known as Operation Sav…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Julie Chavez Rodriguez: Biden's record is 'phenomenal' for communities of color
description: Julie Chávez Rodríguez, Cesar Chavez's granddaughter and senior advisor to the Biden campaign, defends former Vice President Biden's track record with communities of color after he told radio host Charlamagne Tha God that African American voters "ain’t black"…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump allies attack yet fail to hurt Biden expert says
description: Donald Trump allies stand accused of continually trying but failing to harm Joe Biden ahead of the 2020 election, sometimes with illusory stories, experts say. Joy Reid and her panel discuss.
source.name: MSNBC
